definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
right under one's nose/right in front of one's eyes/close at hand/imminent
a wise man knows better than to fight when the odds are against him (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 han4 bu4 chi1 yan3 qian2 kui1

definition: (idiom) ignore your elders at your peril
pinyin: bu4 ting1 lao3 ren2 yan2 , chi1 kui1 zai4 yan3 qian2
containing_words.word: 不听老人言，吃亏在眼前

sentences.english: It was a haunting vision, the past compellingly present.
sentences.chinese: 这是一幅令人难以忘怀的景象，过去分明就在眼前。

sentences.english: In the moment and again the flash across is that girl's face, Qiong's eventually preoccupied of her is who.
sentences.chinese: 眼前再次闪过那个女孩的脸，琼终于想起了她是谁。

sentences.english: There lies a vast extension of golden crops before us.
sentences.chinese: 一望无际的金灿灿的农作物展现在我们的眼前。

sentences.english: It appears as a dusty, cloud-line across the sky.
sentences.chinese: 跨过夜空眼前是一条星星点点云雾线。

sentences.english: Even the sleepy Endymion was fascinated at the sight of the fair maiden as he opened his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 但眼前的一切很快消失，以致他误认为这是一场梦幻。

sentences.english: Stronger is useless, why not Lele eyes?
sentences.chinese: 要强既是没用，何不乐乐眼前呢？

sentences.english: Suddenly the problem of future loomed tangibly for me.
sentences.chinese: 突然，前途的问题明确地出现在我眼前。

sentences.english: Short Stories from Australasia. My book appeared in front of my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我的《澳大利亚短篇小说集》出现在我眼前。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the new technique on extracting anterior segment nonmagnetic foreign bodies.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨眼前段非磁性异物摘出的方法。

sentences.english: The mahjong tiles blurred before her eyes. Her heart ached unbearably.
sentences.chinese: 牌在她的眼前晃动起来，她的心痛得厉害。

sentences.english: The pilot said that at the moment everything was blacked out for him.
sentences.chinese: 那位驾驶员说当时他眼前一片漆黑。

sentences.english: Your first sight of qingyuan will definitely be impressive.
sentences.chinese: 当你第一眼看见清远会立即使你眼前一亮。

sentences.english: Right now I feel like Romeo when he first saw Julieta.
sentences.chinese: 眼前，我有了罗密欧初次遇见朱丽叶的那种感觉。

sentences.english: And then the lake itself is like a plate which spreads before the eyes of the outlooker.
sentences.chinese: 在外来者眼前，西湖看起来就像是一个平放着的圆盘。

sentences.english: However, as seeing the past, we should realize what we get now is not easily come by.
sentences.chinese: 回首过往，方能让人了解到眼前的得来不易。

sentences.english: We let the game slip away, a game that we were in a good position to win.
sentences.chinese: 我们浪费了大好局面，让胜利从眼前溜走。

definition: variant of 彷彿|仿佛[fang3 fu2]
to appear before (one's eyes)/to come to (one's mind)
central point/in one's thoughts/in one's heart
to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
